017package de.mnl.osgi.jul2osgi.lib;
018
019import de.mnl.osgi.jul2osgi.lib.LogManager.LogInfo;
020import java.util.logging.Filter;
021import java.util.logging.Handler;
022import java.util.logging.LogRecord;
023import java.util.logging.Logger;
024
025/**
026 * A {@link Logger} that forwards the {@link LogRecord}s to OSGi.
027 */
028public class ForwardingLogger extends Logger {
029
030    private LogManager manager;
031    private Class<?> definingClass;
032    private static final ContextHelper CTX_HLPR = new ContextHelper();
033
034    public ForwardingLogger(LogManager manager, Logger orig) {
035        super(orig.getName(), orig.getResourceBundleName());
036        this.manager = manager;
037
038        // Find class that invoked getLogger
039        if (getName().length() == 0 || getName().equals("global")) {
040            return;
041        }
042        StackTraceElement[] stackTrace = new Throwable().getStackTrace();
043        for (int i = 2; i < stackTrace.length; i++) {
044            StackTraceElement ste = stackTrace[i];
045            if (ste.getMethodName().equals("getLogger")) {
046                Class<?>[] classes = CTX_HLPR.getClassContext();
047                // Skip all calls within logging package
048                while (classes[i].getPackageName()
049                    .equals("java.util.logging")) {
050                    i += 1;
051                }
052                definingClass = classes[i];
053                break;
054            }
055        }
056    }
057
058    @Override
059    public void log(LogRecord record) {
060        if (!isLoggable(record.getLevel())) {
061            return;
062        }
063        Filter theFilter = getFilter();
064        if (theFilter != null && !theFilter.isLoggable(record)) {
065            return;
066        }
067
068        // Unless parent handlers were to be ignored, we now log to OSGi
069        manager.log(new LogInfo(definingClass, record));
070
071        // We still invoke explicitly attached handlers. Note that the
072        // default root handler will automatically *not* be invoked
073        // because it is not wrapped as ForwardingLogger.
074
075        Logger logger = this;
076        while (logger != null) {
077            final Handler[] loggerHandlers = logger.getHandlers();
078            for (Handler handler : loggerHandlers) {
079                handler.publish(record);
080            }
081            final boolean useParentHdls = logger.getUseParentHandlers();
082            if (!useParentHdls) {
083                break;
084            }
085            logger = logger.getParent();
086        }
087    }
088
089    private static class ContextHelper extends SecurityManager {
090        @Override
091        public Class<?>[] getClassContext() {
092            return super.getClassContext();
093        }
094    }
095}
